H0.text: The Earth rotating on its axis explains why daylight and darkness occur on Earth.

H1.text: The Sun rotates on its axis explains why daylight and darkness occur on Earth.

H2.text: The Earth's axis is tilted, which explains why daylight and darkness occur on Earth.

H3.text: The Earth revolves around the Sun explains why daylight and darkness occur on Earth.

A4.text: The spherical Earth rotates about its axis daily and the apparent movement of the stars is a relative motion caused by the rotation of the Earth.

A5.text: The true solar day tends to be longer near perihelion when the Sun apparently moves along the ecliptic through a greater angle than usual, taking about 10 seconds longer to do so.

A6.text: IERS Earth Orientation Center: Earth rotation data and interactive analysis
